head.title: Hormonal and Paracrine Control of Digestive

body.p: Hormonal control (for long distance regulation) and paracrine control (for short distance, or local, regulation) help maintain processes throughout the digestive system that regulate secretion of chemicals, mechanical changes and absorption of nutrients.

tr.td: Liver, pancreas, gall bladder, Hepato-pancreatic sphincter

Potentiates activity of secretin; increases production of enzyme-rich pancreatic juice; contracts gall bladder and releases bile; relaxes sphincter, permitting bile and pancreatic juice to enter the duodenum

Stimulates parietal cells to release HCl

Fasting; neural stimuli activate release every 1.5 to 2 hours
